page.title: 19Beech, Near Alton
page.content: I live in Beech, which is built beside the road between Alton and Medstead. It is a quiet village to the west of Alton, with many bungalows and houses. It is surrounded by fields and a Forestry Commission woodland, where people can walk along paths in the forest. The village has a small church with a corrugated iron roof and a village hall in which a youth club, scout troop and brownies meet and flower shows are held. Car boot sales are held there too. At the end of Beech is King's Hill. There is an Abbey where monks stay. Every summer they have fruit picking where you can go and pick strawberries and gooseberries. Very near the Abbey there is a little shop called Abbey Stores. One of the houses in Beech is a farm with sheep and hens. It sells plants.
